name: treatment of metal scrap, mixed, for recycling, unsorted, sorting | tinplate scrap, sorted | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/23218/documentation

This activity represents the treatment of mixed metal scrap from separate collection, i.e. a source-segregated municipal solid waste fraction, through sorting for recycling. Sorting of waste tinplate, ferrous metal, and aluminium from residues and from each other, yielding individual material fractions for ferrous scrap and aluminium.

The activity starts with 'metal scrap, mixed, unsorted' being available to the sorting facility.

The activity ends with 'metal scrap, mixed, unsorted' being sorted and 'iron scrap, sorted, pressed', 'tinplate scrap, sorted' and 'aluminium scrap, post-consumer, prepared for recycling, at refiner' being available for transportation at the gates of the sorting facility.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/383:Materials recovery/3830:Materials recovery

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The mixed metal scrap is sorted using magnetic and eddy current separators.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset for GLO has been extrapolated from the corresponding activity in Switzerland. The uncertainty information has been adjusted accordingly.

exchanges.description: Based on Haupt et al. (2017): 1 kg of "tinplate, in mixed metal scrap", yields 0.96 kg of "tinplate scrap, sorted" after the sorting process. The impurities are collected as municipal solid waste stream.
Exchange amount modeled based on relative proportions of recyclable fractions in the mixed input flow to allow for allocation among co-products during database linking.
